page.title: 18THE MODS AND ROCKERS
page.content: During the early 1960's a mass influx of young people roared into Brighton accompanied by screaming scooters and roaring motorbikes.These were the Mods- clean and smart in appearance, trend-setting in the latest fashion clothes,peace-loving and addicted to pop music and the liberty given to them by the scooter - and the Rockers - a group of strong men prone to violence, dressed in heavy leathers who were interested in pushing their machines to the 'ton' as a sign of machismo. Consequently the Rockers hated the Mods, regarding them as cissies and attacking them whenever the chance occurred.The media reported these as 'seaside battles' and perpetuated this image.The activities of the Mods and Rockers were captured in the film, 'Quadrophenia' starring The Who (1970)
